Posts.Content: CynthiaK65 wrote: i am new to the web site... breifly here is what i am facing and needing advice on March 7 of this year i had a phantom lump removed from my left armpit (it was undetected on mammo, ultrasound, mri), turned out to be a 2" diameter lymph node hidden between my muscles - path came benign (with some areas of concern but not enough to constitute cancer as being present).  However since then i have noticed changes in the left breast: inverted nipple (cannot make hardened even with stimulation), pink coloration around areola, areola appears wrinkled, itching, and swelling... is this something i need to contact my doctor about or should i wait and see if worsens? History - numerous aunts, cousins and grandmother battled breast cancer - some having to have a breast removed - just this February my younger sister was diagnosed with 2 types of cancer (Malignant neoplasm upper outer quadrant of left breast & nodes and HER+ matastatic adjuvant breast cancer) which resulted in the loss of her left breast and all nodes Please let me know if this occurence i am experiencing is a result of the surgery of something to be concerned with. thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2013 11:49AM - edited Jun 28, 2013 02:07PM by CynthiaK65 thank you - i have an appointment with my doctor this week on thursday to have him evaluate the problem... my husband is now getting very upset and scared since it seems to be swelling and he can feel what seems to be a large hardened area under the nipple and top of the breast.... Although i am not seeing any leakage, drainage or such - at times it feels like it is "leaking" and the other morning i awoke to find a spot of blood on my sheet where my breast lays (as i sleep on my stomach) So with all this i must say i am terrified - so i am hoping the doc tells me this is just a side effect of having to cut through the muscle in my armpit to remove the 2" diameter swollen lymph node back in March.. but another part tells me... the swollen node was just a warning sign...
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2013 07:02AM CynthiaK65 wrote: Ballet12 - thank you for responding - i live in Guthrie, Oklahoma and work in Oklahoma City, OK - we do of course have the Cancer Institute of America in Tulsa.. i called to speak to someone there about this and was told until i have a firm diagnosis they could not help.. so much for finding information and guideance... I will do some research and find where to get these and the mammogram sent for second opinion readings - and i am willing to drive to Houston if i have to - i will travel where ever God needs me to go to find information and help. Fingers crossed and still hoping ...
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2013 08:08AM CynthiaK65 wrote: UPDATE - coloration remains.. seems it was just "faded" looking due to lighting of the room :-(, now have a pea sized swollen lymph node under left arm, itching is becoming unbearable, constant pain (thank goodness i have a high tolerance - feels like a dull pain for me... but still at times requires i take something), nipple still non-responsive and shrivels up like a raisin if you try to stimulate and make erect...open pores seem to be increasing in number Had MRI yesterday 07/02/13 - the radiologist was to attend so as to see if anything showed up so i could have biopsy same day if it did - however, he did not show for the MRI - so now i wait to see what he sends to the doctor - doc has noted that even if he comes back with negative reading - she will have punch biopsy done. personal note - not confident in this radiologist - while having the US on Friday of last week - he noted to me he was the one who read the MRI showing normal sized lymph nodes (mind you i had a 2" swollen node removed March 7th 2013) and he is the one that read the mammo and stated mastitis (no physical examine by him) and then on Friday of last week did the US (with physical examine) and stated i did not / nor did i have mastitis i have cellulitis... so my confidence is very slim for this man.. and i do not know that i trust his ability...anyone every had that feeling about a professional care provider? My sister is to get the genetic BRCA tests back next week - once have her results - i will be tested Well - i seem stuck in a medical rut and i have to admit.. i do not like it - seems like too much time/energy is wasted spinning wheels and getting no where
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2013 08:04AM CynthiaK65 wrote: i just got a call from Dr. Toma's nurse Vicky - they are sending me for punch biopsy on 07/22/13 at 7am... i told them i am no better, no worse, still the same - and i assured them it is some type of "super bug" that is just resistant to antibiotics - but better safe than sorry.... i did let them know of my reluctance to trust the radioligist - i would love to know more about his experience in detecting IBC before i just take his word on this... he was pretty adimant it was nothing but cellulitis / mastitis - something *itis after the ultrasound as he saw nothing.... He pointed out the lump on the ultrasound which was being felt (it was a large black area - however, it had a small pin size white center - he never mentioned what that was - just that it was clean and looked normal).. well guess we shall see... thank you everyone for your thoughts, guideance and prayers - i wish each of you success, health, and the support you need.
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2013 08:54AM CynthiaK65 wrote: UPDATE: 07/24/13 - Placed on steriod cream for red area of breast (inside of left breast) - was told should see improvement by Monday 07/29/13 - have a followup appointment with dermotoligist - am to call if not showing signs of improvement Question - if they took the biopsy from an area of the breast showing no redness, no peau d'orange, etc.... did they just miss getting the sample needed? has anyone had a clean biopsy come back only to have a second one done in another area which shows cancer?
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2013 01:59PM CynthiaK65 wrote: had a mammogram today because of the "symptoms" - mammo showed thickening on the left breast where the problems are - however, radiologist has decided it is nothing to worry about - as requested a new regiman of antibiotics - if that does not work, revisit with my primary or if symptoms worsen to revisit with primary - also was told the little "pin prick" size holes (which were not there during the beginning of this journey and are increasing in number) are normal... As of yesterday i get on and off again "icy fire" pains in the breast - redness comes and goes - and well the rest remains the same. But according to the "experts" it is all in my head...so... we shall we what my "head" tells me in the future. thank you - but still worried
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2013 02:09PM CynthiaK65 wrote: my doctor has now put me on 10 days of antibiotics - take 1 pill 4x a day - but i now have noticed a "bug" bite near the area where the first red/pink color was - the "bug" bite is not a bite as it is not raised up - nor does it itself itch.. it is just a red dot with a white center similar in appearance to a bug bite.... this is new - my breast now hurts to touch because my nipple was not fully retracted (the bottom is swollen and sticks out until you try to stimulate it - then it goes all the way in) the radiologist is calling it mastistis... i am 47 years old.. i do not breastfeed.. i have no nipple percieings... i have never had mastitis even when i did breastfeed my children - and i have had a hysto (not sure if relevant or not.. but is the case)... i just find it so heartbreaking that women must insist so much for treatment and to be listened to.... perhaps if we were listened to when we state we have a problem then late detection, some illnesses would not be so advanced. will keep everyone posted - as the doctor has stated if second round does not work.. he will send me to a BS - Thank you all for your support and replies - God Bless
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2013 09:37AM CynthiaK65 wrote: well... day 3 of the new antibiotics (2000mg per day for 10days), thus far.. no change - now have what appears to be a bug bite.. breast is very tender - nipple OMG hurts if you touch it... I googled all the symptoms i have and WOW... the first thing that pops up is IBC... so i have been researching - called the doctor and he said if by the end of these 10 days the breast is still swollen, painful, and the color has not changed.. then he will refer me to a BS for further observation... So quick question - if these symptoms are combined with thickening of the skin at the nipple - why do they not test women sooner? especially if you have had one round of anitbiotics - would that not save more lives? Thank you for your helpful replies
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2013 10:11AM CynthiaK65 wrote: i am really getting frustrated - i called the doctor because the pain/symptoms are increasing instead of getting better on the new antibiotics - and was told to give them another few days.. if it continues to get worse to where i cannot handle it any more to go to the ER - and once again assured i have a complex case of mastitis... i woke up this morning to more of the red "bug" bit like spots - i now have 1 on the inside of my left breast and a line of them on left.... my nipple is so swollen it hurts to touch.. the pinkish/red (yes it now turns red / purple at times) comes and goes.. i am experiencing a burn under my arm and in the "bingo fat" of my arm.... am i crazy? how do you keep insisting and pushing without being taken as a hypochondriac.. at this point i have been told to go to the ER if gets worse or to call the doctor back on Tuesday/Wednesday if no improvement - if i go to the ER to inform them of the mammo/ultrasound done and the anitbitotics taken - and perhaps they can have a doctor/radiologist look at the films (really - the cost of an ER visit even with insurance is costly).... lost and getting no where
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2013 05:52AM CynthiaK65 wrote: It is weird that women should hope, wish, pray for anything but this terrible disease....is it normal for symptoms (coloration) to disappear? the pink color seems to come and go.. but i still have the peau d'orange around the nipple, "letting down" sensation, the nipple instead of being as "inverted" is now swollen but still unable to stimulate and make errect, itching and pain.... guess we will find out within the week. My sister is to get her genetic test results end of the week - or sometime next week - which that will open a whole new door of exploration, but will be valuable information to pass to my daughters and their doctors. It still shocks me as to how hard women must fight to learn about their health.. good or bad - it should not be this hard.

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2013 11:45AM CynthiaK65 wrote: the redness began on the inside portion of my breast to the right of the nipple .. it is now on the bottom and top... i cannot touch my nipple without wanting to scream.. i am not running a temp....and it seems to be getting worse while on antibitotics than better.. i have this cold icy pain the "bingo fat" of my arm... What worries me is the 2" diameter lymph node they removed - could it have been a beginning sign... did they test it correctly before saying it was clean.. were there possibly just not enough bad cells concentrated to test - or did they not do the right test?? how do you know. i am going to call my doctor tomorrow if i still see no improvement - i have been doing photo documents of the breast i just dont want to seem like some paranoid fanatic and pushed to the side because of it... but i just feel i know my body better than anyone.. and if test show a change that wasnt there the last time it was done.. why not investigate... mind boggling.. i will keep pressing

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2013 01:42PM CynthiaK65 wrote: Best of luck to you Aliciki - we are all fighters - we have to be. Update on me - pathology report - i have an inflammed breast - steriod topical cream to be applied - return 08/19/13 for followup with dermotoligist Called doctor about report - concerned of them stating the obvious - and worried they did not take the correct sample - the took from out side of breast next to nipple instead of inside of breast where the discoloration and peau d'orange are present... so - will wait for call back from doc on next move - or try the cream - see the dermo in 2 1/2 wks and go from there
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2013 06:39AM CynthiaK65 wrote: Cider8 - i am now on 3rd antibiotic... doctor is rubbing his head wondering why the antibiotics are not working... i brought up IBC and he seemed to have never heard of it and said he needed to pull out his journals again (how reassuring is that - NOT)... but still prescribed another drug. Ariom - it is frustrating to beat the band - you feel something is going on - and yet it at times feels like no one is listening - i guess that is why medicine is a "practice"... not only do the patience learn but the doctors do as well. For all those out there following - i was first treated with Bactrim (2x day) - then Cephoflaxin (4x day = 2K mg) and now i am on Levaquin (1x day)... after brining up IBC and explaining how it differs from other cancers (yes i had to explain this - thank goodness for all the people who give their stories and accounts)  i received a call on Wednesday following my appointment from the Nurse stating the doctor had reached out to others in his profession and inquired about IBC - he was told send her for an MRI quickly - so i will go in for an MRI on Tuesday July 2nd. at 8:30am... so question - will an MRI showing anything? I had the thickening show on the mammogram.. but the radiologist just stated mastitis - thickening due to fluid retension... is there a difference in the appearance of thickening when caused from mastitis or IBC? or is it just seeing it and following through with more thorough testing that makes the diagnosis... i believe this is the experience of all experience (shy of the birth of my children and grandchildren) in my life.... hopefully we shall all learn something - patients will learn to be outspoken when the have a feeling of something wrong, doctors will learn to listen and learn from their patients.... and this terrible disease will at some point be diagnosed long before it becomes as advanced as it does currently before diagnosis and treatment. Thank you all for well wishes, your notes of encouragment - you hopes and your prayers and your support to not just me but all others who are researching this topic either because they have or may have IBC. God Bless
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2013 12:15PM CynthiaK65 wrote: Well got in to see a doctor today at Cancer Specialist of OK - immediately sent to imaging for evaluation - the Dr. at the imaging did an ultrasound due to doctors feeling a lump/knot above my nipple and after done stated he is ALMOST 100% sure it is not IBC and it is not mastitis - it is cellulitis but can not explain why 3 rounds of anitbiotics have not worked... so now have MRI on Tuesday 07/02/13 - he will be in there... if it comes back negative - we do the punch biopsies and see what it shows. Until then still scared - and determined - positive or negative - i feel other women need to be armed and i will be looking for away to spread the word (perhaps that is the whole goal of this journey)

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2013 06:42AM - edited Jul 15, 2013 06:44AM by CynthiaK65 1 week to go and then i have the punch biopsies (07/22/13). The redness fades (not so apparent first thing in the morning) and increases throughout the day - my breast continues to have stabbing pains and hurts to touch... my nipple at times appears to be trying to become erect - but then it will shrivel and become puckered and flush.. and as of this morning i noticed while looking at the underneath i have what appears to be tiny dark looking veins in such a large number my breast looks black (bruised)... i also have a sore spot under my left arm - a tiny knot that unless you were used to examining you would possibly miss. Is this dark coloration normal for cellulitis/mastitis or is this just one more thing i should share with my doctor?
Posts.Title: Swollen, Pinkish Red Breast with inverted/flat itchy nipple CynthiaK65 alicki

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2013 01:25PM CynthiaK65 wrote: RECEVIED CALL FROM PATHOLOGY - INCONCLUSIVE - ONLY THING CONCLUSIVE IN THE REPORT - MY BREAST HAS INFLAMMATION - DUHHHH SO GO BACK 08/19/13 FOR FOLLOW UP - MEANTIME I AM TO USE A STERIOD CREAM TO BRING DOWN THE INFLAMMATION Waiting on a call back from my doctor - as they did the biopsy on the outsid of my breast and not in the inside of my breast where it is "red" Will try the cream - see where that gets me Best of Luck Alicki
